Submodules¶

CactusTool.Lib.power module¶

CactusTool.Lib.power.RadialToTortoise(r, M)[source]¶

Convert the radial coordinate to the tortoise coordinate

r = radial coordinate M = ADMMass used to convert coordinate return = tortoise coordinate value

CactusTool.Lib.power.angular_momentum(x, q, m, chi1, chi2, LInitNR)[source]¶
CactusTool.Lib.power.ffi(freq, data, f0)[source]¶

Integrates the data according to the input frequency and cutoff frequency

freq = fourier transform frequency data = input on which ffi is performed f0 = cutoff frequency

CactusTool.Lib.power.getCutoffFrequency(sim_name)[source]¶

Determine cutoff frequency of simulation

sim_name = string of simulation return = cutoff frequency

CactusTool.Lib.power.get_angular_momentum(python_strain)[source]¶

Save the energy radiated angular momentum sim = string of simulation

CactusTool.Lib.power.get_energy(sim)[source]¶

Save the energy radiated energy sim = string of simulation

CactusTool.Lib.power.joinDsets(dsets)[source]¶

joints multiple datasets which each have a time like first column, eg iteration number of time. Removes overlapping segments, keeping the last segment.

dsets = iterable of 2d array like objects with data

CactusTool.Lib.power.loadHDF5Series(nameglob, series)[source]¶

load HDF5 timeseries data and concatenate the content of multiple files

nameglob = a shell glob that matches all files to be loaded, files are sorted alphabetically series = HDF5 dataset name of dataset to load from files

CactusTool.Lib.power.myFourierTransform(t0, complexPsi)[source]¶

Transforms the complexPsi data to frequency space

t0 = time data points complexPsi = data points of Psi to be transformed

CactusTool.Lib.power.myFourierTransformInverse(freq, hf, t0)[source]¶
CactusTool.Lib.power.psi4ToStrain(mp_psi4, f0)[source]¶

Convert the input mp_psi4 data to the strain of the gravitational wave

mp_psi4 = Weyl scalar result from simulation f0 = cutoff frequency return = strain (h) of the gravitational wave

CactusTool.Lib.power.to_bool(s)[source]¶
